TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit OracleBinary extends System.ValueType implements class System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable, class System.IComparable

Docs.summary: Represents a variable-length stream of binary data to be stored in or retrieved from a database.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To obtain an OracleBinary object, call the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleDataReader.GetOracleBinary%2A> method.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] b) cil managed

Docs.param: The byte array to be stored in the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the `OracleBinary` structure, setting the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value%2A> property to the contents of the supplied byte array.

MemberSignature.Value: public int CompareTo (object obj);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 CompareTo(object obj) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to be compared to this `OracleBinary` structure.
Docs.summary: Compares this <see cref="T:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"> object to the supplied object and returns an indication of their relative values.
Docs.returns:
A signed number indicating the relative values of this `OracleBinary` structure and the object. |Return Value|Condition| |------------------|---------------| |Less than zero|The value of this `OracleBinary` object is less than the object.| |Zero|This `OracleBinary` object is the same as the object.| |Greater than zero|This `OracleBinary` object is greater than the object.

-or-

The object is a null reference.|

MemberSignature.Value: public byte this[int index] { get; }
.property instance unsigned int8 Item(int32)

Docs.param: The position of the byte to be retrieved.
Docs.summary: Gets the single byte from the `Value` property located at the position indicated by the integer parameter, . If indicates a position beyond the end of the byte array, an exception is raised.
Docs.value: The byte located at the position indicated by the integer parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To avoid raising an `OracleNullValueException`, always check the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.IsNull%2A> property and the `Length` property before reading `this`.
